nt_bdr wrote:
>
> I have set up Heretrix to crawl
> http://blackvoices.aol.com/black_entertainment/bvbuzzcanvas/_a/april-3-2006/20060403111909990001 
> <http://blackvoices.aol.com/black_entertainment/bvbuzzcanvas/_a/april-3-2006/20060403111909990001>
>




....


> Any idea what is causing this?
>
> Below is the entry in the crawl log for one of the urls
> 2006-11-10T15:56:32.099Z 404 18684
> http://blackvoices.aol.com//black_entertainment/bvbuzzcanvas/_a/april-3-2006/aol.com 
> <http://blackvoices.aol.com//black_entertainment/bvbuzzcanvas/_a/april-3-2006/aol.com>
> X
>







The 'X' at end of log line above means the URL was result of speculation 
(Heritrix will try various techniques to try and uncover possible URLs.  
Usually its a miss but on occasion it'll uncover a gem). 

I haven't done the analysis but I'd 'speculate' that the URL-finding 
regex at the head of the JS Extractor -- see 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/extractor/ExtractorJS.html#66, 
and then its application later in the code here, 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/extractor/ExtractorJS.html#142 
-- when it came across the below sequence from the seed page,

<script type="text/javascript">document.domain = "aol.com";</script>


.... extracted "aol.com" and 'speculate'd that the 'filename' aol.com 
resolved relative to the base of the seed page was a possible URL.

St.Ack


> .
>
> .
>
>
